meanings.definition: Fenthions (noun): a type of organophosphate insecticide
meanings.sent1: Farmers use fenthions to protect their crops from bugs.
meanings.sent2: The fenthions sprayed on the plants helped keep the insects away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous bugs tried to steal the fenthions, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The fenthions acted like a shield, guarding the plants from harm.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of fenthions filled the air, deterring pests from approaching.

meanings.definition: Fenthions (verb): to apply fenthions to crops for pest control
meanings.sent1: Farmers fenthions their fields to keep insects away.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fenthions the plants regularly to ensure their health.
meanings.sent3: The farmers decided to fenthions the entire farm in one day.
meanings.sent4: She carefully fenthionsed the crops, making sure to cover every leaf.
meanings.sent5: The workers will fenthions the fields tomorrow to protect the harvest.

meanings.definition: Fenthions (adjective): relating to or characteristic of fenthions
meanings.sent1: The fenthions solution had a distinct smell that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent2: Scientists conducted tests to study the effects of the fenthions compound.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat sniffed at the fenthions bottle on the shelf.
